citation.article-title: Corynebacterium spheniscorum sp. nov., isolated from the cloacae of wild penguins
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Corynebacterium spheniscorum sp. nov.
Corynebacterium spheniscorum (sphe.nis.co′rum. N.L. masc. n. Spheniscus a genus of penguin; N.L. masc. pl. gen. n. spheniscorum of penguins).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, non-motile rods.
Colonies are whitish, circular, smooth, entire and approximately 1–2 mm diameter on Columbia blood agar after 24 h incubation at 37 °C.
Facultatively anaerobic; grows slightly under anaerobic conditions.
Non-lipophilic, and CAMP-positive with S. aureus.
Aesculin, gelatin and urea are not hydrolysed.

Acid is produced from glucose, ribose, d-fructose, d-mannose, trehalose, N-acetyl β-glucosamine and maltose, but not from d-xylose, l-xylose, mannitol, lactose, rhamnose, galactose, adonitol, inositol, d- or l-arabinose, sucrose, melibiose, melezitose or glycogen.
Activity for ester lipase C8, esterase C4, pyrazinamidase and leucine arylamidase (weak) is detected.

Alkaline and acid phosphatase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, chymotrypsin, trypsin, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase are not produced.
Long-chain fatty acids are of the straight-chain saturated and monounsaturated types, with C16 : 0 and C18 : 1ω9c predominating.
Isolated from the cloacae of apparently healthy penguins (Spheniscus magellanicus).
The type strain is strain PG 39T (=CCUG 45512T =CECT 5986T).
